definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Before Wang's lecture, to sang songs for a whole night with my undergraduate students.
sentences.chinese: 聽王老師講座前一天，跟本科生去唱了一晚的歌兒。

sentences.english: Well, undergraduate? I think here, there is enough housing if people want it.
sentences.chinese: 本科生？我覺得只要有學生想住，肯定有房間。

sentences.english: Currently there are nearly 6678 undergraduates from all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 學院面向全國招生，現有在校本科生6678人。

sentences.english: The text can be used at the advanced undergraduate and graduate level.
sentences.chinese: 文本就可以被用在高年級本科生和研究生的水平。

sentences.english: As an undergraduate, Chi Wa was an extremely active junior research assistant.
sentences.chinese: 他當本科生時，是個非常躍的初級助研。

sentences.english: Methods 195 undergraduate and associate degree students in grade 2 were selected by cluster sampling.
sentences.chinese: 方法整羣抽取二年級本科生和專科生共195人。

sentences.english: And I know what it is to write a typical undergraduate paper.
sentences.chinese: 我也知道典型的本科生論文是怎麼寫的。
在校全日制本科生近32000人。

sentences.english: But the biggest cash cow is lower-division undergraduate education.
sentences.chinese: 但是最大的搖錢樹卻是層次較低的本科生教育。

sentences.english: Garber first came to Harvard in 1973 as an undergraduate.
sentences.chinese: 加伯於1973年作爲一名本科生首次來到哈佛大學。

sentences.english: We come together with different undergraduates.
sentences.chinese: 我們會和不同的本科生見面。

sentences.english: For example, a few of the graduate-entry medicine degrees might require some knowledge of science.
sentences.chinese: 比如說，有些本科生入讀的藥學學位需要有科學知識。

sentences.english: He also works as a sessional instructor teaching software engineering to undergraduate students.
sentences.chinese: 他爲本科生擔任軟件工程臨時講師。

sentences.english: Hi, my name's Dan. I'm a undergraduate. Also taking Gordon's class.
sentences.chinese: 我叫Dan，是參加過戈登課的本科生。

sentences.english: Fifty English majors from English Department, Capital Normal University (CNU) were selected for the research.
sentences.chinese: 有五十名首都師範大學的英語本科生參與此研究。

sentences.english: Compared with the undergraduates, the daily life of a Ph. D student appears rather simple and flavorless.
sentences.chinese: 與本科生相比，博士的日常生活顯得非常平淡無味。

definition: student graduating in the current year/recent graduate
master's degree/person who has a master's degree/learned person
science and engineering as academic subjects
to recommend sb for postgraduate studies/to admit for postgraduate studies without taking the entrance exam
to join the faculty of one's alma mater upon graduation/to remain at school during vacation
universities and colleges/abbr. for 高等學校|高等学校
